content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and perfect for a clash.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's fun to solve and the goal is very clear.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple enough yet multiple possible solutions possible. So ideal for a clash

I found this fun!
It's a pleasure to solve with Regex.
I'll be ready to approve after the author apply @5DN1L 's fixes.

Looks like a nice puzzle, if feedback is addressed! 
Also, there doesn't seem to be any test close for the extremes (length = 1, length = 100)
And I feel like this could be a "Reverse" puzzle too.

Input / Output / Constraints
* Please follow the example in the link below to format all variables and constants and re-present all three sections: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Goal
* Please format 0 and 1 as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints
* Please change 10‚Å∂ to 100 as no input consists of more than 10 digits, and cases with longer inputs should be added (see below).

Stub generator
* Please change 1000000 to 100.

Cases
* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs and outputs. Please revise all validators accordingly.

* Please add a new pair of cases where the first block of 0s is the longest. Each input should consist of more than 10 digits.

* Please add a new pair of cases where the longest block of 0s is neither the first nor the last. Each input should consist of more than 10 digits.

Thanks.
The author hasn't followed up so far. Although the issues don't break the clash (which is why I didn't reject it), I'd very much hope they've been resolved. üòî

Oh... I just saw your comment has a follow-up.
Do you think it would be better if I removed my approval so that the author has another chance to fix the remaining issues?
No worries. You can't remove your approval once the contribution has been accepted by enough reviewers.
Got it. I'll pay more attention next time üòÖ.
Thanks for being mindful about it going forward. Much appreciated üôÇ

Thank you for the quick response. The only remaining issue is to re-present the sections:

Input
* Please change "The input is a single line of plain text" to "<<Line 1>>: A string [[lampSequence]]".

* Please delete "The input sequence has no leading or trailing whitespace and is non-empty."

Output
* Please change "Output a" to "<<Line 1>>: A".

* Please change "the input sequence" / "the input" to "[[lampSequence]]".

Constraints
* Please delete "The length of the input sequence is between 1 and 100 (" and ")".

* Please add "of [[lampSequence]]" after "length".

* Please change "The input" to "[[lampSequence]]".

Thanks.
